meanings.definition: Tending to seduce or lead astray
meanings.sent1: Her seducive smile made him forget his worries.
meanings.sent2: The movie had a seducive plot that kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent3: The cat's seducive purring convinced the owner to give extra treats.
meanings.sent4: The seducive melody of the song captured everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The painting's colors were so seducive that they drew people in.

meanings.definition: Having the quality of seducing or enticing
meanings.sent1: The perfume had a seducive scent that lingered in the air.
meanings.sent2: The dancer moved with a seducive grace on the stage.
meanings.sent3: The salesman's seducive pitch convinced many customers to buy.
meanings.sent4: The garden had a seducive beauty that enchanted all who visited.
meanings.sent5: The book's cover had a seducive design that attracted readers.

meanings.definition: Capable of seducing or attracting someone's attention
meanings.sent1: His seducive voice could charm anyone who listened.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement used a seducive image to draw in customers.
meanings.sent3: The dessert looked so seducive that it was hard to resist.
meanings.sent4: The actress had a seducive presence on stage that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The new car model had a seducive appeal that caught everyone's eye.
